intro_text: r_c finds a wounded rat near the Thunderpath.
decline_text: They leave the wounded rat alone.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol approaches the injured rat and sees signs of life. They gingerly pick up the rat and take them back to camp to be treated by the medicine rat. The rat is grateful for their help and decides to join the Mischief.

fail_outcomes.text: As r_c inspects the rat, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/find/finds} that they are already hunting with their ancestors.
The rats attempt to carry the rat back to camp, but the rat passes on the way. They stop to bury the rat before continuing home.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The patrol tries to drive the rat away, but they trip and stumble over a loose twig. They lay on the ground and don't get back up. The patrol takes a bit of time to bury them - just to keep the predators away.

antag_success_outcomes.text: Your patrol drives the rat off of the territory. It's not c_n's problem.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol immediately stops their border marking and switches to tracking the scent of the intruder instead. At the end of the trail they find an old fancyrat, wheezing {PRONOUN/n_c:0/poss} Twoleg's name. p_l doesn't care if this fancyrat wants {PRONOUN/n_c:0/poss} Twoleg - {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject} {VERB/n_c:0/smell/smells} sick, and needs medicine rat attention.

The patrol immediately stops their border marking and switches to tracking the scent of the intruder instead. At the end of the trail they find an old fancyrat, wheezing {PRONOUN/n_c:0/poss} Twoleg's name. s_c steps up, and tells the patrol they'll be taking this fancyrat back to camp for healing. In Tigger's name. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}'ll tell the story later.

Swerving to follow the scent trail, the patrol almost falls over a hissing queen. Reeling with surprise, no one hears exactly what she spits out about never letting herself be taken - but she grabs something and flees. It's only as the patrol regroups that they hear the distressed calls of her other pinkies.

This isn't going to last, but that isn't going to stop {PRONOUN/p_l/object}.

intro_text: Your patrol cautiously moves towards the sound of barking. Near the border, they spot a dog chasing something. Oh no, it's a rat!
decline_text: The patrol decides not to interfere. Surely the rat can handle itself, the dog isn't even that big.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol swiftly jumps into action. They capture the dog's attention and draw it away from the rat. r_c stays hidden and goes to the rat while the rest of the patrol lures the dog away. They're unharmed, and this display of bravery makes them want to join the Mischief!

s_c leaps into action, pelting towards the dog with a yowl rising in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} throat. The dog looks alarmed by this newcomer and abandons the chase as s_c swipes at it. The loner, ruffled but unharmed, is amazed by this display. After some chatting, they decide to join the Mischief.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol swiftly jumps into action. They capture the dog's attention and draw it away from the rat. r_c stayed hidden while the rest of the patrol lured the dog away, but when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/go/goes} to find the rat, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/see/sees} that it's still running! Oh well, at least they're alright.

The patrol jumps into action and chases the dog off without much difficulty. A group of rats is much different than a single one. However, the distressed loner seems to think that they're a threat and takes a swipe at r_c before running off.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred when a loner attacked {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
history_text.reg_death: m_c died after a loner attacked {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The loner escapes the dog by climbing a tree and scowls at the patrol, who stood by watching.

antag_success_outcomes.text: Your patrol watches as the loner climbs up a spindly tree to escape the dog, and then promptly proceed to chase the dog out of the territory and warn the loner not to cross the border.

intro_text: While searching for some specific herbs, p_l is startled by weird sounds and whispers on the wind.
decline_text: Unnerved and unable to discern if it is a sign from StarColony or nothing, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/go/goes} back to c_n to ask for help and guidance.

success_outcomes.text: The sounds die away and then start up again in strange, unpredictable intervals. Investigating, p_l suddenly finds {PRONOUN/p_l/self} nose to nose with a panting, bleeding queen, one desperately trying to keep their newborn litter quiet. p_l brings the queen back to camp, where the Mischief can assist.

p_l follows the strange sounds on the wind and finds a struggling queen with their pinkies clinging to them. r_c sprints back to camp to find help while p_l tries to make the queen eat some strengthening herbs. Thankful for the help, the queen joins c_n with their pinkies.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l follows the strange sounds on the wind and finds the bodies of an unknown queen with their pinkies beside them, slowly going cold. r_c goes back to camp to find help bringing their bodies back to camp to pay respects.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: p_l begrudgingly follows the sound, only to find the bodies of an unknown queen and their pinkies beside them. If p_l had been quicker... Whatever the case, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/return/returns} home, {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} mind clouded.

success_outcomes.text: It's just an odd loner singing to themself. p_l greets them, and as the loner's home isn't on c_n territory, it's a polite interaction without any hostility. The older rat looks like they could use a meal, and p_l invites them to c_n's camp. The loner agrees.

It's just an odd loner singing to themself. When they see p_l they invite {PRONOUN/p_l/object} to sing along, but instead, p_l offers the strange, battered-looking rat an introduction to c_n. It's got to be far less lonely than their current life.

s_c walks into an ambush set by a group of rogues. It's only by the grace of StarColony that s_c has the fighting skill and confidence to escape, running for {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} life to get back to camp.

s_c has a bad feeling about this. At first it seems like {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} being too cautious - but then {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/pick/picks} up on the scent of strange rats lingering around the Twoleg nest. Forewarned, s_c retreats to safety.

intro_text: The patrol hears some odd noises coming from an abandoned Twoleg nest out on the cliffs above the beach.
decline_text: The patrol decides not to investigate.

success_outcomes.text: It's just an odd loner singing to themself. The patrol greets them, and as the loner's home isn't on c_n territory, it's a polite interaction without any hostility. The older rat looks like they could use a meal, and p_l invites them to c_n's camp. The loner agrees.

It's just an odd loner singing to themself. When they see r_c they invite them to sing along, but instead, r_c offers the strange, battered-looking rat an introduction to c_n. It's got to be far less lonely than their current life.

The patrol walks into an ambush set by a group of rogues. It's only by the grace of StarColony that s_c is there, fighting with the ferocity of PhoberomysMischief, the strength of MagnaMischief, and the agility of MonesiMischief. Shaken, but no more than bruised, the patrol manages to retreat to safety.

s_c signals for the patrol to stop. Carefully, quietly, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/explain/explains} {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} concerns about the unknown situation. At first it seems like {PRONOUN/p_l/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} being too cautious - but then p_l picks up on the scent of strange rats lingering around the Twoleg nest. Forewarned, the patrol retreats to safety.

fail_outcomes.text: Your patrol walks into an ambush. Before p_l can so much as yowl a warning, a group of rogues creeps from the shadows to surround the Mischief rats on all sides. Few of the rats manage to escape, and any that are left behind are found the next morning, cold and covered in battle wounds.

history_text.reg_death: This rat died in an ambush set by rogues.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: r_c can sense it's a trap, and tries to get the upper paw, only to find rogues waiting for {PRONOUN/r_c/object} there too. r_c escapes with {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} life, but fear in {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} heart.

antag_success_outcomes.text: r_c can sense it's a trap, and waits just outside, setting {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} own trap. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/manage/manages} to set up such a yowl that it sends the rogues running as if PhoberomysMischief were after them.

intro_text: As the patrol is checking the border lines, they hear an odd sound coming from a nearby bush.
decline_text: It's probably nothing. The patrol leaves the noise alone and continues on their way.

success_outcomes.text: p_l goes to check the bush and finds a loner sheepishly hiding inside. It seems the stranger was thinking of asking to join the Mischief. They're a bit intimidated though and, after speaking to p_l for a little while, they decide to join the Mischief.

p_l pads towards the bush to check on the noise when a rabbit suddenly bursts out with a young rat chasing it! p_l stops the rat, impressed with their hunting skills, and invites them to join the Mischief, to which the young rat agrees.

s_c cautiously checks the bush, only to be surprised by a weight slamming into {PRONOUN/p_l/poss}! {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/recover/recovers}, only to see a young loner snarling at the patrol. Impressed with the rat's bravery, s_c invites them to join the Mischief, to which the young rat agrees.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l pads closer to the bush, intent on finding the source of the noise, only to come face to face with a skunk! The poor rat ends up stinking for days after the unfortunate incident.

s_c doesn't even hesitate before splitting from the patrol to check on the source of the noise. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} quickly {VERB/s_c/regret/regrets} {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} impulsivity, however, when an angry raccoon bursts from the bush! s_c gets quite the scare, but thankfully the raccoon only wanted to get away from {PRONOUN/s_c/object} and quickly runs off back into the undergrowth.

p_l takes the lead in checking the source of the noise and comes face to face with a rogue hiding in the bush! The rogue takes a swipe at p_l, but doesn't get much damage in before p_l retaliates and chases the intruder out of c_n territory.

history_text.scar: m_c gained a scar after tussling with a rogue.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: A loner and their pinkies emerge from the bush, but p_l shakes {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} head, and {VERB/p_l/tell/tells} the loner {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} meant it when {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} said {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} didn't want to see them again. The loner hisses and scratches at p_l. Rumors start at camp over what p_l said to the loner.

antag_success_outcomes.text: A loner and their pinkies emerge from the bush, but p_l shakes {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} head, and {VERB/p_l/inform/informs} {PRONOUN/p_l/object} there's no room in c_n.

decline_text: Your patrol decides not to investigate.

It's just an odd loner singing to themself. When they see the patrol they invite them to sing too, but instead, p_l offers the somewhat battered looking and strange rat an introduction to c_n. It's got to be far less lonely than their current life.

Your patrol walks into an ambush by a group of rogues. It's only by the grace of StarColony that s_c is there, fighting with the ferocity of PhoberomysMischief, the strength of MagnaMischief, and the flexibility of MonesiMischief. Shaken, but no more than bruised, the patrol manages to retreat to safety.

And maybe {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} being too cautious - but then p_l picks up on the scent of strange rats around the Twoleg den. Forewarned, the patrol retreats to safety.

fail_outcomes.text: Your patrol walks into an ambush by a group of rogues and everyone is slaughtered.

history_text.reg_death: This rat died from being ambushed by rogues.

intro_text: r_c hears some odd noises coming from an abandoned Twoleg nest out on the plains.
decline_text: r_c decides not to investigate.

It's just an odd loner singing to themself. When they see r_c, they invite {PRONOUN/r_c/object} to sing too, but instead, r_c offers the somewhat battered looking and strange rat an introduction to c_n. It's got to be far less lonely than their current life.
s_c walks into an ambush by a group of rogues. It's only by the grace of StarColony that s_c has the fighting skill and confidence to escape, running for {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} life.

s_c has a bad feeling about this. And maybe {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} being too cautious - but then {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/pick/picks} up on the scent of strange rats around the Twoleg den. Forewarned, s_c retreats to safety.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c decides that a quick peek can't hurt. As {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/venture/ventures} into the nest, ears pricked with curiosity, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/don't/doesn't} notice the lithe forms of rogues moving to block the entrance until it's too late. r_c never makes it back to camp.

history_text.reg_death: This rat died from being ambushed by rogues while on a solo patrol.
history_text.lead_death: {VERB/m_c/were/was} killed in a rogue ambush while on a solo patrol

antag_fail_outcomes.text: r_c can sense it's a trap, and tries to get the upper paw, only to find rogues waiting for {PRONOUN/r_c/object} there too. r_c escapes with {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} life, but fear in {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} heart.

antag_success_outcomes.text: r_c can sense it's a trap, and waits just outside, setting {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} own trap. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/manage/manages} to set up such a yowl that it sends the rogues running as if PhoberomysMischief were after them.

intro_text: The patrol approaches a Twoleg nest in the woods while hunting.
decline_text: The patrol decides to hunt elsewhere.

success_outcomes.text: p_l hears r_c softly calling {PRONOUN/p_l/object} through the bushes, and drops the idea of following mouse scent, hurrying to {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} mate's side. r_c, head poking into the nest's garden through a gap in the fence, murmurs something about Twoleg pinkies. Twoleg pinkies? No, r_c corrects, the Twolegs's pinkies, the Twolegs have pinkies wandering through the nest's garden, they need to be rescued.

Near the Twoleg den, p_l suddenly hears furious growls. Tiny, adorable, furious growls. A pinkie tries to pounce on p_l, barely coming up to {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} elbows. Before little teeth can do any damage, p_l gently flips the tiny rat over and places a gentle paw on their back, completely pinning them as they struggle with all their might. r_c, called over by the mighty fight, asks the little scavenger what on earth they're doing. Why, they're defending their territory of course!

Furious, high pitched yowls greet the patrol, as a tiny fancyrat pinkie comes roaring out of the Twoleg nest to try and fight them. Terrifying. s_c tips the little fighter over and carefully scruffs the tiny scavenger - they can't leave them here. The pinkie insists that they're a big rat and they're fine, but after a couple minutes, does reveal their mother is dead. Twolegs have kept them alive somehow, but c_n will do better.

fail_outcomes.text: Twoleg pinkies scare the patrol away.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The fancyrat pinkies trying furiously to defend their territory ruin all the hunting to be had, and the patrol returns home, irritated but impressed by the pinkies' bravery.

antag_success_outcomes.text: A fancyrat pinkie approaches the patrol, yowling furiously. p_l bats it aside as the scavenger continue hunting, unruffled.

intro_text: As the patrol is checking the border lines, they hear the traipse of pawsteps through the territory.
decline_text: They decide to leave it alone. It's probably just another Mischiefmate out in the territory.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol approaches warily and comes upon a fancyrat that's sniffing around. The fancyrat notices their arrival and brightly says that they've heard about the Mischief and wish to join. The patrol agrees to take them back to camp.

The patrol follows the noise and comes upon a fancyrat that's sniffing around. The fancyrat notices them and bundles towards the patrol, whose pelts bush out in surprise. The fancyrat quickly begins a story about how they've been training for days now and they're finally ready to join c_n. Well alright then!

The patrol follows the noise and comes upon a fancyrat that's sniffing around. The fancyrat turns and bristles, hissing at the patrol. s_c calls out a greeting to them and engages them in conversation, which seems to calm them down. They even agree when s_c asks if they'd like to join the Mischief!

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol follows the sound, intent on finding the intruder. They come upon a fancyrat sniffing around. When the fancyrat notices them, however, it turns tail and makes a hasty getaway. At least it's off the territory now.

The patrol follows the sound, intent on finding the intruder. They come upon a fancyrat sniffing around. They're about to approach calmly when s_c lets out a yowl and rushes towards the fancyrat, who quickly turns tail.

The patrol follows the sound, ready to confront the intruder. They come upon a large fancyrat that's sniffing around. They begin to approach, but the fancyrat immediately turns on them. r_c doesn't have enough time to move as the fancyrat launches a quick attack. p_l bats the fancyrat away and helps r_c back to camp.

history_text.scar: This rat gained a scar from a fight with an angry fancyrat.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The patrol follows the noise and comes upon a fancyrat that's sniffing around. The fancyrat quickly begins a story about how they've been training for days now and they're finally ready to join c_n. p_l laughs and gets swatted by the angry fancyrat. Embarrassed, the patrol goes home.

antag_success_outcomes.text: The patrol follows the sound, intent on finding the intruder. A fancyrat! No wonder they were so loud. They scare them off easily.

intro_text: The patrol is checking along the border lines when they hear a startling sound - a hiss of pain? They quickly follow the sound to the source. It's a loner, and they appear to be injured.
decline_text: It's probably nothing. The patrol leaves the noise alone and continues on their way.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol approaches cautiously. The loner draws themself up, but doing so causes them to let out another hiss. p_l offers to bring them to camp. Though they seem hesitant, the loner agrees.
The patrol approaches cautiously. The loner lifts their head and asks for help. p_l agrees. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} can't leave a fellow rat to die.

The loner hisses defensively as the patrol comes closer. s_c speaks soothingly to the loner, assuring them that they mean no harm and simply want to help. The loner seems distrustful, but allows p_l to help them back to camp.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol warily approaches the loner, who doesn't seem to notice them. It's obvious that the rat is bleeding out. p_l attempts to staunch the bleeding and carry the rat to camp, but it's no use. Hopefully the loner didn't suffer too much.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The patrol approaches the loner cautiously, intending to attack. Instead, they find a StarColony warrior, who scolds them all for being willing to attack a hurt loner. With shame in their hearts, the patrol goes back home, and tell no one of what they saw.

antag_success_outcomes.text: The patrol launches into attack, only to find the loner that they've been fighting is too weak to fight back. They go home with blood on their paws.

intro_text: It's a cold day in c_n's territory, and app1 is the only rat stepping out. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP}{VERB/app1/'re/'s} by {PRONOUN/app1/self} when {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/hear/hears} a rat screaming for help.
decline_text: Nope, not today, there's no way app1 is running after ghost cats, no thank you.

success_outcomes.text: It's probably dangerous, but... there's no way app1 can live with leaving some poor soul alone on the mountainside in the cold. Following the piteous cries, app1 rounds a bend and spots a puffed out bundle of terrified screams sitting by the side of one of the few Thunderpaths that cross c_n territory. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP} {VERB/app1/sigh/sighs}, climbing down the slope and calling out in reassurance to the fancyrat.

StarColony, but the rat {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/find/finds} is weird, their fur soft and thin, their cries desperate as they call in confusion. app1 comes down to them, startling the poor thing half out of their pelt, and ask if they need assistance - this rat clearly doesn't belong here.

app1 follows the sad cries to find a fancyrat, lost and alone and cold. The apprentice introduces {PRONOUN/app1/self} cheerfully, and the desperate fancyrat slowly loses a little of their fear as app1 guides them back to camp, sure that the Leader will know what to do with them.

fail_outcomes.text: The rat seems to be moving all over the place, and finally, app1 gives up and goes home, too tired to catch more than a mouthful.
s_c calls out to the rat, only to be met with raucous cawing. {VERB/s_c/Are/Is} {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} being laughed at? {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/decide/decides} to slink off, leaving it be.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: app1 charges after the sound to attack the rat, only for a fancyrat to bowl {PRONOUN/app1/object} right over as the terrified Twoleg pet, fully grown and fat, runs app1 over in their haste to get away.

antag_success_outcomes.text: app1 screams that this is c_n's territory and there's no help for anyone else. A fancyrat runs from {PRONOUN/app1/object}, terrified of the echoing voice.

intro_text: The patrol hears desperate screams coming from a nearby lake.
decline_text: It's not the scream of any rat p_l recognizes, so {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/decide/decides} to continue the patrol without checking it out. Surely whoever it is will be fine. Surely.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol races towards the sound. They're puzzled when they only see a Twoleg, but realization soon dawns when the bag it holds thrashes and wails. Jumping into action, the c_n rats startle the Twoleg into letting go of the bag. While the angered Twoleg is distracted, p_l and r_c hurriedly get the shivering old rat out of sight, promising them safety in c_n for as long as they wish.

s_c sees the Twoleg, the thrashing bag, the stones piled within - it's now or never to save this poor rat. The patrol leaps and claws at the Twoleg, while s_c sneaks over to the bag, gently hurrying the elderly rat to a safe hiding place. As the patrol retreats, s_c softly reassures the old rat, promising that c_n would be honored to take them in.

fail_outcomes.text: As soon as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/see/sees} a Twoleg holding a thrashing, screaming bag, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/leap/leaps} into action. Unfortunately r_c is just a tad too slow, earning quite a hard kick against a tree. p_l orders the patrol to protect and carry r_c while they retreat, hearts aching for the rat they couldn't save.

s_c can't take the sight of the Twoleg clutching the screeching bag. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/leap/leaps} into action without waiting for the rest of the patrol to back {PRONOUN/s_c/object} up, and {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/pay/pays} the price. Grabbed by the scruff and thrown hard to the ground, all the patrol can do is grab s_c and flee to the safety of c_n.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The patrol quickly turns away once they realize that a Twoleg and a fancyrat are involved. Not their problem. Still, when they hear a loud splash, and the screaming bubbles and stops, everyone goes quiet. The rest of the patrol is spent in silence, shame churning their stomachs and making them feel ill.

antag_success_outcomes.text: As soon as the patrol realizes that the sound is coming from a Twoleg clutching a screeching bag, they quickly turn and resume their patrol. fancyrats are not their problem.

intro_text: p_l hears desperate mewling coming from the ocean.
decline_text: {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/decide/decides} that {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} imagination is just playing tricks on {PRONOUN/p_l/object} and continue the patrol.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol races towards the section of beach they heard the wailing coming from. To their horror they see several pinkies just barely keeping their heads above water, the remains of a Twoleg thing trapping them in place. p_l and r_c leap into the water, grabbing the pinkies by their scruffs and handing them over to the rest of the patrol.

s_c, upon seeing several pinkies trapped by a Twoleg contraption, immediately jumps into the cold harsh water of the sea. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/use/uses} a piece of wood as a makeshift raft and {VERB/s_c/paddle/paddles} the pinkies back to shore where the rest of the patrol can keep them warm, before racing them back to camp to be cuddled into the pelt of a loving queen.

fail_outcomes.text: To the cats' horror, they were too late, the bodies of several pinkies washing ashore. They mutter a prayer before gently picking up the pinkies, and the patrol swims the little bodies back out into the cold ocean, ensuring that the pinkies rest within the ocean's embrace.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The rats argue with each other about whether or not they should check out the source of the mewling. By the time they've decided what to do, the sound has already faded away.

antag_success_outcomes.text: Hissing to {PRONOUN/p_l/self}, p_l turns and stalks off to continue the patrol, deliberately ignoring the mewls. It must be a trick of the wind, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/inform/informs} {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} companions, and no rat dares to argue.
